body:
Building a PC for around $1k
What are your opinions on this parts list? Should I wait it out for Microsoft 10?

replies.body: The power supply was only that one because atm the cheaper ones are sold out and can't be placed on a wishlist until they come in stock, I have every intention of replacing it. For the CPU and GPU what do you specifically suggest? Keep in mind $1000 budget for the PC.

That CPU is pretty garbage, must games don't even utilize 6 cores, you would be better off getting a stronger one whcih has 4 cores, like an i5 or i7.

I would suggest not buying a copy of windows 7 if you don't need to, what OS do you have on your current machine? if it is win7, just pull the code and do a fresh install of that. with that $115 off, and by opting out with a cheaper power supply (you dont need 850w for that build.) you could change out the 270x for a gtx 970.

That's pretty bad, you chose an AMD which already is garbage (i'm against AMD's), a terrible motherboard and you're spending $200 on a PSU for no reason, Also i wouldn't get that GPU, a GTX 760 would be a better option or a 750 Ti.
